lorenz.description: [The Lorenz Wheel](http://www.ace.gatech.edu/experiments2/2413/lorenz/fall02/) is a chaotic system. This is a chaotic description of it.
lorenz.name: Lorenz Wheel

doom.description: How much of the game Doom can you code up in 90 minutes? *Bonus points for creativity.*
doom.name: Minimum Viable Doom

huffman.description: [Huffman encoding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huffman_coding) is one of the simplest text-compression algorithms, but it's also quite effective. Implement it.
huffman.name: Huffman Encoding

merkle.description: A [Merkle tree](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merkle_tree) is a data-structure used in in peer-to-peer file transfer networks. Given a set of file blocks, you can compute if the whole file has arrived undamaged. You can also compute *some* integrity information even if you only have a few of the blocks. Implement the data-structure.
merkle.name: Merkle Trees

pi.description: The Monte Carlo method is probably easiest, but there are plenty of others.
pi.name: Calculate Pi

sheeppen.description: Drop sheep at random points in a field. What's the smallest length of fencing you'd now need to enclose them all? ([Suggested Algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotating_calipers).)
sheeppen.name: Sheep Pen

brainfuck.description: [Brainf*ck](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainfuck) is probably the simplest virtual machine a programmer can implement. Write one.
brainfuck.name: Brainf*ck

church.description: [Church encoding](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_encoding) is a novel way of dealing with arithmetic. Code it up.
church.name: Church Encoding

qr.description: How do they work? Generate one!
qr.name: QR Codes

trumpinmovies.name: Trump As A Movie
trumpinmovies.description: Last I looked, Donald Trump's approval rating was the same as Rotten Tomatoes' rating of the film Mall Cop. We need to track this correlation in real-time.
